title: What are the limitations of ethics? - Quora

response.answer_text: Ethics, like anything else, is relative. That’s the biggest limitation. Our moral and social values that go on to constitute our own ethical structure, are actually shaped by a number of circumstances. For instance, in the midst of a communal riot, you lie to a blood-thirsty mob about your religious affiliations, you’re doing the right thing, because you’re preserving God’s order of things in trying to save your own life, or that of others. But you lie just for the sake of it, you’re a compulsive liar, and try to benefit yourself through people’s misconceptions. That’s deception, and utterly unethical! Now, for instance, you kill people on a battlefield, you’re awarded for your valour and you’re a decorated hero! But you murder someone otherwise, and you’re a criminal! That’s what is the limitation of our ethics. That they are guided by other factors, and you always have hundreds of theories to support your choice.
